channel.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post
channel.description: The Washington Post Sports section provides sports news, video, scores, analysis and updates about high school, college, and pro sports teams, including the Capitals, Nationals, Redskins, United and Wizards. Post Sports also offers blogs and discussions about the latest sports news.

image.title: Sports: Sports News, Scores, Analysis, Schedules & More - The Washington Post

item.title: Aaron Rodgers reminds Stephen Tulloch that you don’t have to get hurt celebrating a TD
item.description:
Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers fired a mild little shot at Detroit Lions linebacker Stephen Tulloch over the embarrassing, oft-GIFed way in which his NFL season ended in a discount-doublecheck move gone wrong.

Read full article >>
item.dc:creator: Cindy Boren
item.ExtractedText: By Cindy Boren December 10 at 10:38 AM Follow @cindyboren (Mike Roemer) Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers fired a mild little shot at Detroit Lions linebacker Stephen Tulloch over the embarrassing, oft-GIFed way in which his NFL season ended in a discount-doublecheck move gone wrong. “I just wanted to remind people you can do that celebration and not hurt yourself,” Rodgers said Tuesday on his radio show on 540 ESPN Radio Milwaukee . “It wasn’t even really a big one. It was just a little one.” Tulloch tore his anterior cruciate ligament doing Rodgers’ State Farm move after sacking the quarterback in a Sept. 21 victory over Green Bay. Evidently, Tulloch’s knee is healing faster than his ego. First off I wasn't doing the discount double check when I got hurt. So my man A Rod can’t stop promoting his discount double move. — Stephen Tulloch (@stephentulloch) December 10, 2014 9 years and one small setback.If you followed my career you know, I'll be back better then ever. I've beaten bigger odds than this in life. — Stephen Tulloch (@stephentulloch) December 10, 2014 Much respect to A Rod, great player. I'll leave it at that. — Stephen Tulloch (@stephentulloch) December 10, 2014 Maybe Rodgers can remind the Lions again about the move, since the teams close out the season against each other. After spending most of her career in traditional print sports journalism, Cindy began blogging and tweeting, first as NFL/Redskins editor, and, since August 2010, at The Early Lead. She also is the social media editor for Sports.
